title: (Mercantile Marine Fund) Act 1898 (1898, c.44) is amended by the substitution
heading: 2. Subject to Article 3, the Second Schedule to the Merchant Shipping
text_raw:
2. Subject to Article 3, the Second Schedule to the Merchant Shipping 
(Mercantile Marine Fund) Act 1898 (1898, c.44) is amended by the substitution 
of the following for paragraph 1 of Part I: 

“Payments per voyage

title: (Mercantile Marine Fund) Act 1898 (1898, c.44) is amended by the substitution
heading: 1. (1) A ship, other than if liable to periodical payments under paragraph 2,
text_raw:
1. (1) A ship, other than if liable to periodical payments under paragraph 2, 
shall, subject to subparagraph (2), be liable to a charge for each voyage of 78 
cent per ton, subject to a minimum charge of €75 or a maximum charge of 
€39,000 for the voyage. 

(2) Where a ship has paid dues under subparagraph (1) in respect of a voyage 
it shall not be required to pay dues in respect of any subsequent voyage in any 
period of one month commencing with the last preceding relevant date. 

(3) For the purpose of subparagraph (2) the relevant date (other than before 
1 April 2025) means the date on which a ship arrives at a port or place on a 
voyage in respect of which light dues were paid or payable. 

(4) In any year commencing on 1 April a ship shall not be required to make 
payments on account of light dues for more than 9 voyages in total in that year. 

(5) A voyage of a ship shall be reckoned from port to port and a voyage 
which begins and ends at the same port without a call being made at any other 
port shall count as a single voyage. 

(6) A dues payment on account of light dues made under subparagraph (1) 

in any year shall not entitle the ship to— 

(a) 

(b) 

any exemption from dues in accordance with subparagraph (2), 
or 

limitation of 

any 
subparagraph (4) beyond 30 April in the following year.”. 

liability for dues 

in accordance with

title: (Mercantile Marine Fund) Act 1898 (1898, c.44) is amended by the substitution
heading: 3. The amendment, by Article 2, of subparagraph (1) of paragraph 1 of Part
text_raw:
3. The amendment, by Article 2, of subparagraph (1) of paragraph 1 of Part 
1 of the Second Schedule to the Merchant Shipping (Mercantile Marine Fund) 
Act 1898 (1898, c.44) shall only apply to a ship that arrives at a port or place on 
and from 1 July 2025 on a voyage in respect of which light dues were paid or 
are payable. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 27th June, 2025. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [273] 3 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

24 June, 2025. 

DARRAGH O’BRIEN, 
Minister for Transport. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [273]

title: (Mercantile Marine Fund) Act 1898 (1898, c.44) is amended by the substitution
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order increases the level of light dues levied on Merchant Shipping 
collected from vessels calling to ports within the State from 60 cent to 78 cent 
per ton from 1 July 2025 and increases the tonnage ceiling from 40,000 net 
registered tonnage (NRT) to 50,000 NRT. The maximum number of voyages for 
which dues may be levied remains at 9 voyages in any one year. 

 
 
 
 [273] 5
